intro: Parishia borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo parishia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within lowland rainforests. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Parishia borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
